at.ac.tuwien.infosys.www.phpparser
Class ParseNode

java.lang.Object
  at.ac.tuwien.infosys.www.phpparser.ParseNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public final class ParseNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

An interior or leaf (token) node in the parse tree. Not all methods are meaningful for both interior and token nodes, so they may throw an UnsupportedOperationException in such cases.

Version:
July 14, 2005
Author:
Nenad Jovanovic
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Summary
ParseNode(int symbol, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String fileName)
          Constructs an interior node.
ParseNode(int symbol, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String fileName, java.lang.String lexeme, int lineno)
          Constructs a leaf (token) node.
 
Method Summary
 ParseNode addChild(ParseNode child)
          Adds a node to this node's children and makes this node the given node's parent (for non-token nodes only).
 ParseNode getChild(int index)
          Returns the child node at the given index (for non-token nodes only).

          Returns this node's children.

          Returns the name of the scanned file.

          Returns this node's line number (for token nodes only).

          Returns this node's line number if it is a token node, and the line number of the leftmost token node reachable from this node otherwise.

Constructor Detail

ParseNode

public ParseNode(int symbol,
                 java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String fileName)
Constructs an interior node.

Parameters:
symbol - symbol number
name - node name (useful for output)
fileName - name of the parsed file

ParseNode

public ParseNode(int symbol,
                 java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String fileName,
                 java.lang.String lexeme,
                 int lineno)
Constructs a leaf (token) node.

Parameters:
symbol - symbol number
name - node name (useful for output)
fileName - name of the parsed file
lexeme - lexeme (the literal string in the parsed file)
lineno - the lexeme's line number in the parsed file

getChild

public ParseNode getChild(int index)
Returns the child node at the given index (for non-token nodes only).

Parameters:
index - the desired child node's index
Returns:
the child node at the given index
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this node is a token node

getParent

public ParseNode getParent()
Returns this node's parent node.

Returns:
this node's parent node, null if this node is the root node

getLexeme

public java.lang.String getLexeme()
Returns this node's lexeme (for token nodes only).

Returns:
this node's lexeme
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this node is not a token node

getLineno

public int getLineno()
Returns this node's line number (for token nodes only). Note that epsilon nodes have line number -2.

Returns:
this node's line number
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this node is not a token node

getLinenoLeft

public int getLinenoLeft()
Returns this node's line number if it is a token node, and the line number of the leftmost token node reachable from this node otherwise. Note that epsilon nodes have line number -2.

Returns:
a reasonable line number

getId

public int getId()
Returns this node's ID.

Returns:
this node's ID

isToken

public boolean isToken()
Returns true if this node is a token node.

Returns:
true if this node is a token node, false otherwise

setParent

public void setParent(ParseNode parent)
Sets this node's parent node.

Parameters:
parent - the parse node that shall become this node's parent

addChild

public ParseNode addChild(ParseNode child)
Adds a node to this node's children and makes this node the given node's parent (for non-token nodes only).

Parameters:
child - the parse node that shall become this node's child
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this node is a token node
